trans-unit.source: This guide will help you correctly install Taiga UI

We use LESS as CSS preprocessor for our library. If you make a new project, you can choose it by default with --style less flag.
I have a project with LESS
Import our global styles in yours styles.less. It adds global classes and CSS variables
You can also add a set of our mixins and LESS-variables to use it in your LESS files
I don't use LESS
Append our global styles to styles of your app in angular.json. It adds global classes and CSS-variables
It is not a regular case, but if you need to use our LESS-mixins or LESS-variables, you can add additional LESS-styles for your component
Angular resolves it automatically
For non-LESS environment, do not forget about file type if you import styles directly from our library

Many of our components need your app to be wrapped into tui-root. Import TuiRootModule in your main module.
Wrap all content of your app with root component
Taiga UI also has optional modules for dialogs and notifications. If you need these features, add modules into your app.module.ts

Icons are not included in the bundle. To add icons provide TUI_ICONS_PATH token with a function that gets icon name and returns path to it.
First of all, add icons into assets of your app:
Then you should provide path with a token:
See Theme to learn more about theming

Taiga UI uses CSS custom properties for styling that is not supported by Internet Explorer. If you need to support IE 11, use
css-vars-ponyfill
package
Install it:
Add polyfill to APP_BOOTSTRAP_LISTENER of your app
Internet Explorer also does not support native SVG inlining. Taiga UI icons will be automatically downloaded and inlined directly into DOM. However, Angular Sanitizer removes SVG code in that case. To use a custom sanitizer that properly supports SVG provide the TUI_SANITIZER token. We recommend you to use our library
ng-dompurify
to properly sanitize code with
DOMPurify

See
README.md
instructions of i18n package

Addon Doc allows you to create documentation like this page
You can install it for your demo project: npm install @taiga-ui/addon-doc
And use with project
README.md
instructions.
We maintain these projects ourselves and higly recommend them for modern Angular apps
A tiny library that abstracts over different ways of view customization in Angular with one simple attribute component. Included with @taiga-ui/cdk

Angular event plugins library for optimizing change detection cycles for performance sensitive events (such as touchmove, scroll, drag etc.) and declarative preventDefault() and stopPropagation() as well as capture phase listeners. Included with @taiga-ui/cdk and enabled by TuiRootModule

This library implements DOMPurify as Angular Sanitizer or Pipe. It delegates sanitizing to DOMPurify and supports the same configuration. See
DOMPurify

This accessor allows you to use Angular forms with contenteditable elements with ease. It has zero dependencies, other than Angular itself as peer and works with Angular 4+ in all modern browsers, including Internet Explorer 11
An element that allows to show and hide content in sections
Only one section of accordion can be opened by default
Other sections are closed when user opens one
Waits for a custom event TUI_EXPAND_LOADED before opening. Content is initialized when opening starts
Import TuiAccordionModule into a module where you want to use our component
Component that shows some action. Better use it in a group.
Import TuiActionModule into a module where you want to use our component
Use Avatar to view person or company. It can be photo, icon or first letters of name.
Autocolor if there is no image
Name (Avatar shows first letters of name if there is no image)
Better do not use big images with Avatar. Some browsers like IE or Firefox work with resized image not so good.
Import TuiAvatarModule into a module where you want to use our component
Badges show text and number values. Number values may show new message or notifications.
Use badges to attract attenton to a new or updated content. Number values may also be with "+" sign that shows that number is more than maximum value to show.
Value. If value is a number and is more than 99, it will be replaced with 99+
Import TuiBadgeModule into a module where you want to use our component
Use CSS and status="custom" for support colors
BadgedContent is a wrapper for other components to add badges and notifications to them.
Bottom right content. If it is a number, badge shows it. If it is a string, it will be used as icon. Warning: use big icons for all sizes except 'xs'.
Top right content. If it is a number, badge shows it. If it is a string, it will be used as icon. Warning: use big icons for all sizes except 'xs'.
Bottom right content color. If there is no content, shows a small circle of this color.
Top right content color. If there is no content, shows a small circle of this color.
Import TuiBadgedContentModule into a module where you want to use our component
Navigation element that shows a path from root page to the current
Import TuiBreadcrumbsModule into a module where you want to use our component
TuiButtonModule is a module with components tuiButton, tuiIconButton are components to use them with native button and a elements.

Link cannot be disabled. If you want to make an unactive link, remove href attribute or send an empty string into routerLink. To prevent keyboard focus when routerLink, use [tuiFocusable]="false" directive
Import TuiButtonModule into a module where you want to use our component

A handler that gets a date and returns true if it is disabled.
Must be a pure function
A handler that gets date and returns null or a tuple with circled marker colors
Import TuiCalendarModule into a module where you want to use our component
Import TuiCardModule into a module where you want to use our component
Set card styles with color, background-color, background-image:
Set invalid state regardless of control
Native ID attribute for element. It helps users with Screen Readers to use a page
Emits by press and press down
Checkbox withour a label. For indeterminate state, set null as value. If you need a labeled checkbox, see CheckboxLabeled. If you need a checkbox inside a button, see CheckboxBlock.
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiCheckboxModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
Declare a form (FormGroup) or a control (FormControl) in your component:
Align of dropdown (does not work together with limitWidth === 'fixed')
Set a vertical direction of dropdown
Minimum height to calculate that dropdown fits to setted tuiDropdownDirection
Content of hint (does not show tooltip if content is null)
autocomplete attribute for a native input (see names)
Shows a cross to reset a value
Right content (e.g. card icon with maximum size 32x32px). If it gets a string, it is inserted as src or as icon name into tui-svg
inputmode attribute for a native input. You can use it to set screen keyboard view on mobile devices
Label is outside a component and made with Label
Maximum number of symbols to type. Does not with with mask together
type attribute for a native input

CheckboxBlock can be used in forms where selected option does not change or update content (e.g. does not work like a filter). It may be grouped in horizontal row only except the mobile and tablet view
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiCheckboxBlockModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
CheckboxLabeled is a Checkbox with a label. Click on label changes checkbox state. If you do not need a label, see Checkbox.
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiCheckboxLabeledModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
ColorPicker allows to pick a color and its transparency. InputColor and ColorSelector are made with ColorPicker
Import TuiColorPickerModule into a module where you want to use our component
Static checkbox for usage outside forms as visual incdocator without focusing and clicking. For usage in a form, see Checkbox, with a label CheckboxLabeled, inside a button CheckboxBlock.
Import TuiPrimitiveCheckboxModule into a module where you want to use our component
ComboBox is a textfield with a dropdown with items. You can choose one of available options or input a value manually.

Set a value with copied object from items to check identityMatcher:
Set
Textfield value to subscribe on input or setting it from the outside (emits null when item from list selected)
A function that compares search and value to define a match between them. Must be a pure function
Value must be only item of items
A function that compares search text and item to define a match between them. Lowercase string comparasion function by default. Should be a pure function
A function that transforms object into a string. String(value) by default. Should be a pure function
A template for custom view of selected value
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiComboBoxModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
See samples to learn more about working with tui-data-list-wrapper or without them
DataList allows to make lists or menus
Import TuiArrowModule if you need a rotated arrow
Native accessability role listbox(default) or menu for common usage
Native accessability role. Set aria-checked for all roles except menuitem (see sample)
Import TuiDataListModule into a module where you want to use our component
Error allows to show an error. If you work with a form, see TuiFieldError.
Active state for routerLinkActive, for example
Import TuiErrorModule into a module where you want to use our component
Waits for a custom event TUI_EXPAND_LOADED before opening. Content is initialized when opening starts
Import TuiExpandModule into a module where you want to use our component
FieldError shows a validation error of a field. If you do not use forms, see TuiError.
Import TuiFieldErrorModule into a module where you want to use our component
If you need to show validation message as early as a user started to type something, subscribe on form value changes and call markAsTouched on control on first value change
A component and a directive for grouping other components. For example, textfields and buttons.
Items take all available width. If you want to prevent it, use class="tui-group__auto-width-item".
If you want item to inherit border radius, use class class="tui-group__inherit-item"
Remove margin between items (2px by default)
The first and the last items are rounded
Horizontal or vertical direction of group
Import TuiGroupModule into a module where you want to use our component
If you have nested components, it would be better to use tuiProjectClassDirective that projects classes from parent to host element
Directive helps to avoid extra layers of HTML
tui-hosted-dropdown is a wrapper for focusable elements to attach to them a dropdown. Working with keyboard is also included.

If it is not, mouseclick opens and closes a dropdown. A component uses the first focusable item inside component as a host for opening a dropdown. If you want another element to be host, use tuiHostedDropdownHost directive.
Do you like using Taiga UI?
Import TuiHostedDropdownModule into a module where you want to use our component
Import TuiInputInlineModule into a module where you want to use our component
Input is a singleline textfield. Not recommended to use with numbers, because the value of this components is a string
Inputs for other types of data:

TextArea for multiline text
InputDate for dates
InputDateRange for a range of dates
InputNumber for number (with measurement postfix)
InputPassword for passwords
InputPhone for phone numbers
InputTag for inputing tags
InputRange, InputSlider for accurate number values
Slider, Range for not accurate number values
InputCount for integer number of smth
An icon. It can be stringified svg or a name of icon registered in SvgService
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiInputModule in the same module where you want to use our component:

Taiga UI input is compatible with
angular2-text-mask
Custom mode is set with tuiMode directive
A list of preset dates for dropdown
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiInputDateModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
If a field is optional, but unfinished field should be marked as invalid, use tuiUnfinishedValidator directive
InputCard can be used with InputExpire and InputCVC to input a card
Add tuiCreateLuhnValidator(customMessage?) to control validators to validate it with Luhn algorithm
Import TuiInputCardModule, TuiInputCVCModule, TuiInputExpireModule modules into the module where you want to use them:
form tag is used for better autocomplete
Import TuiInputCardGroupedModule into a module where you want to use our component
InputCopy alows user to copy a text of textfield
Import TuiInputCopyModule into a module where you want to use our component
InputCount is a good choice to input integer positive numbers under 999
It allows limit value with min and max and handles such cases
It does not indicate validation status
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiInputCountModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
InputDateTime allows to input date and time
Time modes for SS and MS support
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiInputDateTimeModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
An input for upload one or several files. It uses native input file abilities.
Max file size in bytes (30 MB by default 30 * 1000 * 1000)
Array of files that not passed check
Import TuiInputFileModule into a module where you want to use our component
With a custom accept format and async loading
With preset files and actions when deleting
Loading files should also be in control
Sync working with files, no loading state
Component to input a single month
Import InputMonthModule into a module where you want to use our component
Insert a TuiInoutMonthComponent in the template:
Component to input a range of months
With a context usage in disabledItemHandler
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiInputMonthRangeModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
A sample with disabledItemHandler when selecting a left value of range changes available right value: a range no more than one month
InputNumber is a component to inout numbers. Inputed value is formatted: thousands are separated with space. A control value of the component is a number.
Component can be used to input money or sum of something if you choose a currency symbol as a postfix (see tuiCurrency pipe samples).
There are also other components to input numbers: InputCount for integers under 999, Slider and InputSlider for inputing with a slider
A number of digits after comma
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiInputNumberModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiInputPasswordModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
InputPhone allows to input a phone number
Text mask after country code. You can use #,- and spaces as a template sumbol
Textfield value to subscribe on input or setting it from the outside
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiInputPhoneModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
Component to input a range of values
Number of actual discrete slider steps
Anchor points of non-uniform format between value and position
Import TuiInputRangeModule into a module where you want to use our component
A field to input a range of dates
Fixed intervals (shows 2 calendars with empty array)
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiInputDateRangeModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
Component to input a limited range
Key steps to bind slider position and value
Import TuiInputSliderModule into a module where you want to use our component
InputTag allows to input several tags with autocomplete and list in dropdown.
Control height can be expanded to show all tags
Hide input field. For example, to prevent adding new tags
A function that cheks that tag is valid
Import TuiInputTagModule into a module where you want to use our component
InputTime allows input time in HH:MM format
You can set items for dropdown
Modes for seconds and ms support
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiInputTimeModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
If field is not required, but you want to mark it invalid if user did not complete it, use tuiUnfinishedValidator directive
Allows to input phone number in international format
Array of ISO-codes of countries to choose
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiInputPhoneInternationalModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
Islands show information in rounded block with a border
Import TuiIslandModule into a module where you want to use our component
Component binds a label and a content, e.g., a textfield
Import TuiLabelModule into a module where you want to use our component
Component cuts overflowed text with "..." and shows it by hover
Height of single line. It can be computed automatically but you can optimize the component setting it by yourselves and to prevent reflow.
Import TuiLineClampModule into a module where you want to use our component
Link component. It has focus highlight and can be customized with an icon
Icon align to text, right by default
Import TuiLinkModule into a module where you want to use our component
Content overlay when loader is showed
Import TuiLoaderModule into a module where you want to use our component
MarkerIcon is a SVG icon in a circle. Use mode param to choose appearance or set it with custom styles

Marker icons should be 48x48px or smaller. If icon is smaller, it will be cantered.
s size shows an icon as it and other sizes scale it
Import TuiMarkerIconModule into a module where you want to use our component
Import TuiThemeAndroidModule into your app.module and add tui-theme-android component to enable Android theme. TUI_IS_ANDROID can help to recognize Android user
Import TuiThemeIosModule into your app.module and add tui-theme-ios. TUI_IS_IOS can help to recognize iOS user
An inline message with a type (info, success, warning, error) that does not interrupt user actions
Emits click on close cross. When subscribed to, close button appears.
Import TuiNotificationModule into a module where you want to use our component
Component for showing a dialog on mobile devices. It emulates appearance of native alerts on iOS and Android
Import TuiMobileDialogModule into a module where you want to use our component
Choose iPhone into DevTools to see iOS styled dialog.
A calendar for mobile devices. It is used in InputDate and InputDateRange if TuiMobileCalendarDialogModule is imported
You can use TUI_CALENDAR_DATA_STREAM token to set value from outside (see samples)
Conponent should be used on mobile devices as fullscrean dialog
Import TuiMobileCalendarModule into a module where you want to use our component
Import TuiMobileCalendarDialogModule for automatic use with TuiInputDate or TuiInputDateRange:
Component to refresh content after pull top. It emulates appearance of native iOS and Android components

It emits (pulled) event when user wants to start loading.
You can finish loading with TUI_LOADED stream token that can be provided in DI
Import TuiPullToRefreshModule into a module where you want to use our component
Money transforms and shows money sum. There are some ways to show currency symbol and various decimal settings
Set singleColor to true if component is used in a text
Shows positive number with green color and negative numbers with red

not-zero shows not zero pennies (by default)
always always shows pennies
never never shows pennies (do not show them without rounding)

negative-only shows sign for negative only (by default)
always always shows sign (except 0) never never shows sign
force-negative always shows minus (except 0)
force-positive always shows plus (except 0)
The same color for the whole money view
Amount of money to be formatted
Import TuiMoneyModule into a module where you want to use our component
Month picker component. If you want a textfield, see InputMonthRange

A handler that gets a month and returns true if it is disabled.
Must be a pure function
A single month or a range of months
Import TuiCalendarMonthModule into a module where you want to use our component
MultiSelect is a textfield with a dropdown for choosing several items
Textfield can be use for typing
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiMultiSelectModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
Import TuiPaginationModule into a module where you want to use our component
Radio button without a label. If use want to have a label, see RadioLabeled, and inside button RadioBlock.
Set a value with a copy

Function that matches value and items, e.g. if objects are copied. Uses === by default.
Must be a pure function
Emulates disabled state without disabling a form
Radio inside button with custom content
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiRadioBlockModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
RadioLabeled is a radio and a label. Label click changes form value. Without label: Radio.
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiRadioLabeledModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
Component for fast showing many radio buttons. It supports also custom content
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiRadioListModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
Component allows to choose a part of range
Component for choosing date range in calendar
Import TuiCalendarRangeModule into a module where you want to use our component
Select is a field with dropdown to choose one item.
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiSelectModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
Scrollbar implements a custom scrollbar in Taiga UI style.
Native scrollbar is hidden to keep native platform scroll expirience
Use TUI_SCROLL_REF token to get a scrollable container. For example, when working with virtual scroll.
Import TuiScrollbarModule into a module where you want to use our component
Choose a value from a limited range
Import TuiStepperModule into a module where you want to use our component
Svg for working with SVG-images and its colors
SVG image code, link to a file, link to a segment or icon name. If you use name or segment, set icon size with CSS
Import TuiSvgModule into a module where you want to use our component
Component for creating tabs. It emulates appearance and behaviour of native iOS and Android components when TUI_MOBILE_AWARE token is true.
If you use routerLink, add also routerLinkActive directive.
Visible tabs count limit for TabsWithMore only
Import TuiTabsModule into a module where you want to use our component
Tags show information and they can be edited, deleted or clicked.
It works with both tui-tag and a[tuiTag] seletors
Emits tag change (if it was edited to space or empty string, it emits delete)
Import TuiTagModule into a module where you want to use our component
Textfield for multiline input. It can be expanded from its content.
Control height can be expanded to show all content
A number of visible rows in expandable mode
Import TuiTextAreaModule into a module where you want to use our component
It has a fixed size and content scroll by default. But there is also an expandable mode with height increase from content inside
You can set a custom min-height for component
You can use label outside mode with tuiLabel

PrimitiveTextfield is a flexible string input that can be used as a base for complex inputs. Use it as a basis for other components.
Does not work with Angular forms
Gray background text as a hint (e.g. HH:MM:SS for time)
Icon content. If content is a string, it is used as stringified svg or a name of icon registered in SvgService
Unfocusable text after value. For example, currency symbol in InputNumber.
Import TuiPrimitiveTextfieldModule into a module where you want to use our component

AbstractTuiThemeSwitcher is an abstract class to be used for dynamic theme switching. In the sample below you can see a component that extends AbstractTuiThemeSwitcher and reassigns some CSS variables.
Samples of LESS and TypeScript are in elderly component.
Toggle is a switcher between two states. It can be also used with icons and loading.
Show loader. If icons are also enabled, show loader anyway.
All states have the same color
Import TuiToggleModule into a module where you want to use our component
Component to show icons with a hint by hover

To be accessible, hint should be set to a focusable element and user with Screen Readers will listen to hint text after a small delay when focusing textfield. Set unique describeId and use [tuiDescribedBy]="theSameId" directive on focusable element
Import TuiTooltipModule into a module where you want to use our component
...or any custom HTML or logic with PolymorpheusContent:
Import TuiEditorModule into a module where you want to use our component
Rich Text Editor for using with Angular forms
This component is experimental. Use it with caution.
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiEditorModule in the same module where you want to use our component:
Components shows separated items that can be used to filter content on the page. There are also an option with badges.
Function that gets and item and returns a badge value. Uses valueOf to get a number to show by default
Template for custom content in filter
Filter items. Can be an array of strings or an array of objects. If no custom template provided, it uses toString for view
Import TuiFilterModule into a module where you want to use our component
Labels for X. Emptry string is empty stroke, null no stroke
Inset of labels on axis Y
Import TuiAxesModule into a module where you want to use our component
A function that gets segment index and returns its color
Import TuiBarModule into a module where you want to use our component
Bar chart that can be used as a content to axes.
Shows data set in a single bar
Content of segment hint. It gets index of segment as context
Import TuiBarChartModule into a module where you want to use our component
A group of bars for bar chart
Import TuiBarSetModule into a module where you want to use our component
A button for a legend of ring or pie charts
tui-money is used to format currency and fraction
Content of hint for hover. It has $implicit in context with a tuple [TuiPoint, number]
Axis Y range, pixel scale is 1:1
Axis X range, pixel scale is 1:1
Function to stringify a value number to a string in axis X hint
Function to stringify a value number to a string in axis Y hint
Import TuiLineChartModule into a module where you want to use our component
Content of hint for hover. It has $implicit in context with a tuple [TuiDay, number]
Import TuiLineDaysChartModule into a module where you want to use our component
TuiLineDaysChart is used to show data of several months to simplify working with different number of days in months
Content for hint. It gets active segment index in context
Import TuiPieChartModule into a module where you want to use our component
Content in the middle of ring. It gets index of active segment and total sum in context
Import TuiRingChartModule into a module where you want to use our component
Taiga UI uses CSS custom properties. You do not to import anything. Just use variables
Use global .tui-form class and its modifications:

.tui-form__header: form header. Margins: 32px top and 20px bottom.
.tui-form__header_margin-top_none: nullifies margin-top
.tui-form__header_margin-bottom_none: nullifies margin-bottom
.tui-form__header_margin-bottom_small: reduced margin bottom (16px) margin-bottom
.tui-form__row: form row. Margin between rows is 20px.
.tui-form__row_multi-fields: row with several inputs with 20px margin between them
.tui-form__row_half-width: a half width row
.tui-form__row_checkboxes: a row with two columns for checkboxes
.tui-form__multi-field: field in a row tui-form__row_multi-fields. fields with 20px margin between
.tui-form__checkbox: checkbox with a label for two column case
.tui-form__field-note: a secondary text under field
.tui-form__field-checkbox: checkbox under a field
.tui-form__buttons: a block with buttons and margin top 32px
.tui-form__buttons_align_end: align buttons right
.tui-form__button: a button of buttons block
Class tui-container makes a container inside content
.tui-container: width 1104px on screens >= 1360px and 824px on screens <= 1359px

.tui-container_adaptive: width 1104px on screens >= 1360px, 824px on screens >= 1024px and <= 1359px, 608px on screens >= 768px and <= 1023px, 512px on screens >= 600px and <= 767px, 100% on screens < 600px
.tui-container_fullwidth: width 100% with 24px margins on screens >= 1024px and 16px on screens <= 1023px
Different kinds of shadows can be applied with mixin:

Basic shadow: .shadow(1) with .shadow(5) when hovered
Dropdown shadow: .shadow(2)
Modal shadow: .shadow(3)
Sidebar shadow: .shadow(4)
Navigation shadow: .shadow(6)
Mobile modal shadow: .shadow(7)

Use .tui-skeleton class on an element to add skeleton of the same size above it.
You can also use the following modifiers:

.tui-skeleton_light: style for dark background
.tui-skeleton_rounded: rounded as an element
.tui-skeleton_short: short mode
.tui-skeleton_center: short centered mode
.tui-skeleton_text: for containers with texts

You can use global classes or LESS mixins to make (n multiples 4px) margins
Classes are included in global styles of core library, you do not need to setup them
You can build a class with direction and value between 0 and 15 (tui-space_<direction>-<value>).
Mixins are included in local LESS styles, so you need to import them into LESS styles file and add it to classes of your component
Mixin also gets a direction and a value ( .tui-space(<direction>, <value>);).
Vertical and horizontal margins tui-space_vertical-<value> and tui-space_horizontal-<value>
Use .tui-table class to add Taiga styles to a table
An advanced separate @taiga-ui/table package with interactive tables is in development

.tui-table__tr
.tui-table__th
.tui-table__td
.tui-table__subtext: small secondary text into a cell
.tui-table__sort: sorting action button
.tui-table__sort-icon: sorting action button icon

.tui-table_layout_fixed: fixed cell width
.tui-table_font-size_l: "l" text size for the whole table
.tui-table_font-size_s: "s" text size for the whole table
.tui-table_size_l: "l" cell size for the whole table
.tui-table__tr_border_top: border top for the row
.tui-table__tr_border_none: removes border bottom
.tui-table__tr_hover_disabled: removes hovered state of row
.tui-table__tr_cursor_pointer: adds "cursor: pointer" for hovered row
.tui-table__th_font-size_l: "l" text size for table headings
.tui-table__td_font-size_l: "l" text size for a single cell
.tui-table__td_font-size_s: "s" text size for a single cell
.tui-table__td_size_l: "l" size for a single cell
.tui-table__td_align_center: align center for a single cell
.tui-table__td_first, .tui-table__th_first: removes left padding of the cell
.tui-table__td_last, .tui-table__th_last: removes right padding of the cell
.tui-table__td_text_center, .tui-table__th_text_center: alignes text center in a cell
.tui-table__td_text_right, .tui-table__th_text_right: alignes text right in a cell
.tui-table__td_text_overflow: adds "..." when text overflows
.tui-table__sort_active: active state for sort button
.tui-table__sort_up: arrow up state for sort button

Taiga UI uses CSS custom properties for colors and component styles. If you need to support IE browser that does not work with CSS custom properties, use polyfill. Reassign variables in :root block in CSS to make a custom theme. You can also reassign a speficic component styles with tui-wrapper. Theme can be switched in runtime with a
ThemeSwitcher
component. More advanced theming tools and techniques are planned for future releases.
Taiga UI is a modern UI kit for Angular
Taiga UI reveals all the potential of Angular
tuiActiveZone allows to track a scope with that user interracts. For example, for closing dropdown on blur
Import TuiActiveZoneModule into a module where you want to use our component
Add to the template and subscribe to a change:
You can bind different elements with [tuiActiveZoneParent] directive
Zone keeps active after browser tab change
tuiDropdown shows a dropdown with custom template. Use ActiveZone directive to hide dropdown.

Here can be any content You can even insert other components: Do not touch! Everything you want... *
* except cases of Worldwide rights violation
Align of dropdown (does not work together with limitWidth === 'fixed')
Set a vertical direction of dropdown
Set dropdown host manually. For example, it will be a target if someone blurs dropdown with Tab/Shift+Tab. Element with a directive is used by default.
Minimum height to calculate that dropdown fits to setted tuiDropdownDirection
Import TuiDropdownModule into a module where you want to use our component
tuiDropdownSelection shows dropdown with custom template on selected text
Select a text to see a dropdown

Here you can have any content
You can select a text inside a dropdown and it will not close a dropdown

Directive selector. Optional: you can also set a handler that gets Range and returns show/close dropdown

Import TuiLetModule into a module where you want to use our component

Do not forget to add TuiNotificationsModule into your app.module to use it
Singleton you do not need to provide a service. It is just available to inject

To show notification, use method
show<O, I>(
content: PolymorpheusContent<TuiNotificationContentContext<O, I>>
options: TuiNotificationOptions | TuiNotificationOptionsWithData<I>
): Observable<O>
of TuiNotificationsService, where O is output data type and I is input data type. If content does not need input data, the second argument is optional. In the sample above the both of them are number.
You can also just unsubcribe from a stream to hode a notification (this observable is returned from open method). You can save a subscription for that or use takeUntil like tools from RxJs
Use service show method and subscribe to Observable

To pass notification with custom content, you can use
your template .
You can also customize notification logic with a component. Use POLYMORPHEUS_CONTEXT into the component to get context input data and to output results. It has the following interface:
where O is output data type and I is input data type. Do not forget to add notification component into entryComponents of your module:
Use new PolymorpheusComponent(CustomNotificationComponent) to show notification component with a service:
Use emitHook, closeHook and emitAndCloseHook methods to control notification from itself:
If you use it from lazy loading modules, do not forget to use new TuiComponentContent Injector of component where you call it
Notifications can be shown with template
If there are many templates, you can use ViewChildren instead of ViewChild or set them IDs with "#" (see code of this sample)
This notification will be removed after router change (see component sample)
Optional service to show modal windows
Use TUI_DIALOGS_CLOSE token if you need to close dialog with from a stream. For example, this way you can close dialogs by routing:
I am an example of dialog
Dialog has Observer in its context to call next, complete or error of stream. There is also a completeWith method to pass data and close dialog with one action
There is no need in input data for template dialog because you can set it in template. But if you use a component, context is the only way to get data from outside

Dynamic height change

To show a dialog, use method
open<O>(
content: PolymorpheusContent<TuiDialogContext<O, I>>
options: Partial<TuiDialogOptions<I>>
): Observable<O>
of TuiDialogService, where O is output data type and I input data type. In this sample, input data has type number and output data has type string.
You can also just unsubcribe from Observable to close a dialog (this observable is returned from open method). You can save a subscription for that or use takeUntil like tools from RxJs
Show a cross to close dialog
Dialog can be canceled with Escape key or with a click outside
Cross click, overlay click or Escape click emits an error into Observable (you can catch it with "catch" operator or onError handler)
Use open mothod to show a dialog, subscribe to an Observable:

If you want to use your own component as a dialog content, use POLYMORPHEUS_CONTEXT in it. Dialog will provide with this token some useful options: $implicit with Observer<O> and completeWith hook to call next and complete in one action. Do not forget to add your dialog component into entryComponents of your module where you use dialog

You can also use a
template
Use Observer from $implicit field of context to close a dialog or get some data
If you use dialog components in lazy loading modules, do not forget to pass into new PolymorpheusComponent Injector of component where you open a dialog
You can create your own dialogs. For example, special dialogs for mobile apps or with very customizable appearance
Then you need to provide a stream of your dialogs into multi token TUI_DIALOGS.
You can show a dialog with template
Show long mobile dialog with filters

Additional information
In user interface design for computer applications, a modal window is a graphical control element subordinate to an application's main window. A modal window creates a mode that disables the main window but keeps it visible, with the modal window as a child window in front of it. Users must interact with the modal window before they can return to the parent application. This avoids interrupting the workflow on the main window. Modal windows are sometimes called heavy windows or modal dialogs because they often display a dialog box.
Method scroll$: Observable<[number, number]> (emits a tuple tuple [scrollTop, scrollLeft])
Optional. Duration time in ms (0 for an instant scroll).
Call scroll$ method and subscribe to returened Observable:

Singleton you do not need to provide it, just inject into your component and use it

Method to define an icon.
Warning, name of the icon must not start with "<"
Name should be unique.

It is an element on the bottom of screen to show actions by multiselect of some items. It works with custom content.
Use open method and subscribe to returened Observable
If you use component in lazy loading modules, do not forget to pass into new PolymorpheusComponent Injector of component where you open table bar
Directive allows to control dropdown setting in TuiHostedDropdown component or Taiga UI components with dropdown inside
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiDropdownControllerModule in the same module where you want to use our directive:
Use in template on TuiHostedDropdown component or its parent
Directive allows to control hint setting on hint or its parent components. For example, if you want to add tooltip to TuiPrimitiveTextfield, use this directive on it.
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiHintControllerModule in the same module where you want to use our directive:
Use into template on hint or its parent elements:
Directive allows to customize TuiPrimitiveTextfield with parameters that it adds into DI tree
That means that you can use the directive on any root element and it will be customize all textfields in this scope
If there are several controllers above textfield, their values will be merged. The nearest directives are in priority
Import an Angular module for forms and TuiTextfieldControllerModule in the same module where you want to use our directive:
Use it on tui-primitive-textfield or its parent elements
Warning: decorator overrides getter/setter of input
Decorator stops undefined values if they were passed into input. If it gets undefined, it will use default value and show an error message about the problem in console in dev mode.

See
RequiredSetter
for work with setters
You can also pass contract function of type TuiBooleanHandler<T> with the component instance as this. If check is unsuccessful, it shows an error message about the problem in console in dev mode.
Arguments for console.error if check is unsuccessful
Add @tuiDefaultProp to input of your component
Decorator for memoization of pure methods and getters
Decorator can help to cache result of methods or getters that can be computed once in the first call. The next calls to getter will just use computed static value.
If you use decorator with methods, it does not compute the result again if arguments did not change after the last call (concept similar to Angular pure pipes)
Add @tuiPure decorator for your method or getter:
Decorator stops undefined values if they were passed into setter input. If it gets undefined, setter will not be called and it will show an error message about the problem in console in dev mode.
Add @tuiRequiredSetter to setter input of your component
A set of utils to calculate math
round, floor and ceil with fixed common problems of the native implementation
Checks if the value is in range
Normalizes any number to an integer within inclusive range
Rounds a number to the closest value in a fixed discrete series
Clamps a value between two inclusive limits
Adds a fillter to a string
Returns a currency symbol from its three letter code or ISO 4217
Capitalizes every work in a string
Formats a phone number with separators
A set of tools for easy DOM manipulations
Logs assert into console in dev mode
Calculates a length of elements of two dimensional array
Card number to its payment system
Checks value not to be null or undefined
